data.title: The Official Steve Vai Website
data.text:
Answers #07: January 2003

Hi Steve,

I bought your last opus recorded during the live sessions and i was really happy to find ones you made with us on the 23rd of march 2000 in Bordeaux (it was not at the â€œTheatre Barbeyâ€ but at the â€œKrakatoaâ€). In the song â€œBeing With You (in Paris)â€, who composed the few lines in French? (really nice accent!). I hope you will have time to answer to me.

A french fan.

Charlier Fabien

Steve writes:

â€œOoops, I donâ€™t know how we put the wrong venue name but thanks for pointing it out. I will ask Mike to post it on the site. I composed the letter that was then read in French at the show. It was translated by John Pusztai who was also the one that recited it. Itâ€™s sticky sweet.â€

John Pusztai (pictured here with Steve) tells the story of how it all came about:

â€œHereâ€™s what happened on what was probably the most incredible day of my life so far: Iâ€™m a Vai fan. Actually thatâ€™s a bit of an understatement, but you get the picture. I also live in Paris, and after attending the local gig of the Ultra Zone Tour here on March 15th (2000), I thought there was no way I wasnâ€™t gonna see that show again, so I went to Strasbourg. I got to the venue around 4pm that day (April 1st), and the doors were open. Talk about blind luck!

The band was doing the soundcheck. I sat down in the back, where some other people were hanging. Obviously it was amazing! At one point, they started to play that song Steve had just written, which sounded like a Parisian ballad. Then I heard Steve saying he needed a translator. I was sitting next to his tour manager, so I told him I could do it. And it worked!

So there I was up on stage! I thought Steve just wanted to talk with some french person, but actually, the song they were rehearsing was written for France: they were going to perform it that night, and record it in order to put it on a live album. Steve asked me to translate a poem he had written from English to French, and to recite it in the song. It was about a particular day he had spent in Paris with Pia, and what the feelings it had evoked in him. Too bad Phil (Bynoe) doesnâ€™t speak French though, it would have made it sound like Barry White! (j/k ). I went to the dressing room to do the translation, and then we rehearsed it a couple times. Then the soundcheck came to an end. It was time for the band to relax before the show and to have dinner. I went to a nearby chinese restaurant with my friends but I couldnâ€™t eat!

Eventually the show started. I spent most of it running around backstage almost shitting my pants, I was beyond nervous! Right after Voodoo Acid, it was time for me to hit the stage. Pure adrenaline! It went pretty well, although I think I was shaking a bit. It was very magical. God what a memory! Everyone in the crew was really cool to me. My deepest gratitude to you guys, especially to Steve for making this happen, for being my greatest inspiration (not only musical), and many other things!

Warm Regards â€“ John Pusztaiâ€

I notice on a lot of your album you mention using Eventide Harmonizers. Do you know where I can buy one and how much they cost? Also, is there any way I can buy a left-handed version of any of Ibanezâ€™s Signature Steve Vai series guitars?

â€“ Sherri Durham

Check out www.eventide.com for more info on the Eventide Harmonizers.

There (was) a lefthanded version of the Jem produced: the JEM555LWH. This is still available in some music stores â€“ or check on ebay, and jemsite.com.

Is there going to be another Merry Axemas CD? The first two were simply too

damn stuning.

-Pedro Henrique

S â€“ â€œMaybe sometime in the future but there are no plans at this time.â€

Hi, I watched a program on TV the other day about one of the seven wonders of the world, which got me thinking, because they said something about an eye in a triangle/pyramid being on a note. I wasnâ€™t really listening untill they talked about the triangle thing. I started listening because I saw the same triangle thing on Steveâ€™s album â€˜Passion and Warfareâ€™. I didnâ€™t realise â€™til I came to find the email address â€“ itâ€™s also on the website. Unfortunately I didnâ€™t catch what they said about it on the TV â€“ but itâ€™s something to do with â€˜new orderâ€™ and alexandria. Could you tell me what this triangle symbol thing means? and why steve uses it?

thank you,

charlie .. big fan of steve

S â€“ â€œIf you research metaphysics you will find mystical meanings for pyramids and triangles, and the power of numerology and the number 7 being a prime focus. I had made many discoveries whilst I was seeking spiritual balance in my life. I believe there is cause and effect based in metaphysics, and the study of which can bring one closer to the roots of the human being. But l have also found that more than not they can be a big deterrent in the progress of spiritual evolution, and at times very dangerous. Numerology, mystics, fortune telling, etc., all have their place and their reality but at the core of the matter, is where the essence of it all really is, and everything else is just an obstacle in getting there. What Iâ€™m saying is, I wouldnâ€™t worry about the pyramid and the numbers.â€

Hi Steve,

On your fantastic album The 7th Song, (my lovely wife bought it for my Xmas), at the end of the 11th and final track, the track number does not change but the CD continues, and to my amazement â€˜Warm Regardsâ€™ from Fire Garden starts (which is definitely not the 7th track from Fire Garden, its track 18). The track is played in full. Was this an intentional addition? Or was it a pleasant mistake? If it is a mistake, is it limited to a certain CD batch or are they all the same? Could my copy be rare? I truly hope so. Please reply â€“ I would love to hear your response.

Thank you for the music.

Warmest Regards,

Robert Termer

S- â€œIt was an intentionally hidden track, surprise!â€

Hey Steve, Iâ€™m big fan of yours. What was your rig in Flexable? Did u use a Carvin amp like those seen in the â€˜crossroadsâ€™? When did u start using the JEMâ€™s?

â€“ Martin Philip Bengson

S â€“ â€œFor Crossroads I was using a Carvin X-100B amp along with a Charvel guitar

that turned into my Green meanie guitar. I was using an MXR distortion, Cry

Baby Wha Wha and a Roland SDE 3000 for delay.â€

Steve designed and began using the Jem in 1987.

Dear Steve,

If I am not mistaken you recorded with Dweezil many years ago on a cut called â€˜Crunchy Waterâ€™. If I am correct, is that cut available anywhere?

Thanks-

Jeff Cole

S â€“ â€œCrunchy water was the flip side of a track called â€œMy Mother is a Space Cadet.â€ I wrote My Motherâ€¦ with Dweezil but I did not play on it. That was Edward Van Halen that produced and played on it. I have no idea where you can find a copy. I donâ€™t even have one.â€

I just heard a killer version of Steve doing â€œSomewhere Over the Rainbowâ€â€¦what can you tell me about it?

We often get asked about this track, as well as a few others floating around on filesharing services out there called:

Steve Vai â€“ â€œBeethovenâ€™s 5thâ€

Yngwie Malmsteen/Steve Vai â€œDuetâ€

Satriani/Vai â€“ â€œFormula 1â€

S â€“ â€œI donâ€™t ever recall playing â€˜Somewhere over the Rainbowâ€™, or â€˜Beethovenâ€™s 5th.â€™ I donâ€™t ever recall jamming with Yngwie, and I have never heard of a track that Joe and I properly recorded called â€˜Formula 1.â€™ I think itâ€™s all rumors, mistakes or misnamed things.â€

VAI.COM UPDATE: Thanks to the many fans who wrote in helping clear up this confusion. We have heard that â€œSomewhere Over The Rainbowâ€ is actually performed by Chris Impellitteri, and that â€œBeethovenâ€™s 5thâ€ is performed by Nuno Bettenbourt (weâ€™ve been unable to confirm this).

The track â€œFormula 1â€ is apparently a mis-titled version of â€œJuiceâ€ that appeared in the video game â€œFormula 1â€. A Satriani track also appeared in the game soundtrack â€“ hence the confusion.

As far as Steveâ€™s attitude toward filesharing, read his thoughts belowâ€¦

I was wondering what Steveâ€™s opinion is on all this stuff going on about [peer-to-peer filesharing], mp3â€™s, and free music over the internet.

â€“ Mike Ricci

S â€“ â€œI think that ripping tracks from the Internet is a blatant disregard for the intellectual property rights of the artists that create the art, most of whom live hand to mouth. Believe it or not, â€œfile sharingâ€ is bringing the music industry to an all time low and at the end of this we will see at least a 25% decline is sales. That will put a lot of Indies out of business, make the majors smaller and less effective in marketing, and discourage many musicians from making music as it will seem more and more hopeless to make a living in the business. So, buyer beware of what your doing when you rip from the net. I have never even once in my life downloaded a track from the net for free because I know how it effects the artists.â€

Hello from Finland!

I would like to know if SteveÂ´s hearing has suffered after so many years in loud bands? I have many friends who have hearing loss and tinnitus. Does he use anything on stage to protect his hearing?

Yours sincerely

Aki JÃ¤rvelÃ¤

S â€“ â€œI have always protected my ears with ear plugs or cotton whenever I play

on stage or in rehearsal. As a result they are still good. I get periodic

check ups too. The only other thing I ever stick in my ear is my elbow.â€

Hi Steve I am 14 years old and have been playing the guitar for two years now. I was wondering what kind of things you were playing when you were around the age of 14?

One of your biggest fans,

Adam â€œaxmanâ€ Wallace

S- â€œHi Adam. When I was your age I played a whole lot everyday but I would break it up into different categories. Exercises, scales, chords, jamming to tapes, reading music and just sitting and improvising. All in all I would spend about 9-15 hours a day. I highly recommend playing to a drum machine or loops as this will help you get your groove together, play with as many different people you can as musical communication is tremendously important, and just love music all the time. Be supportive of other peoples musical contributions and struggles.â€

Will Fire Strings ever be released on CD or video?

â€“ Jay

S- â€œEventually everything I ever recorded will be released in one way or another.â€

Hi there Vai!

My name is Magnus Rubach Wendt, Iâ€™m a 17 years old guitar player from Norwayâ€¦ I play guitar all day longâ€¦ but lately Iâ€™ve been getting a real pain in the wrist (fretting hand)â€¦ everybody tells me to rest from the guitar!!! Its horribleâ€¦ I love playingâ€¦ I want to play all the time!! Help me, pleaseâ€¦

How can I play all day, without getting injurie in my wrists!!!

An answer would be more than great!

-Magnus

S â€“ â€œJust playing is not necessarily going to make you a great musician. There are many things you can do to improve yourself while you let your hand rest. Itâ€™s difficult to rest when you want to play, I know, but you must because you can damage yourself.

Develop your ears. Get some books on solfeggio and sight singing. Learn to hear music in your head while looking at it on paper. Sit and write melodies that you hear in your head. Practice much slower, hitting only one note every 30 seconds and make it sound great and listen to it ring out.

Create tapes of chords that you can listen back to and name when you hear them, this is great ear training. Listen to inspirational music that you like. Study theory and imagine how you can apply it to the instrument. These are few things.

s

Answers #06:

Being a Christian myself, I really admired that, but in the song â€œFuck Yourselfâ€ you say â€œthe Lord will be fuckingâ€¦.â€ Steve, I laughed so hard at that song but that line seriously offended me. â€œSorry, I did not mean to offend you. That particular line in the song is aimed at people who use religion as a means of personal and monetary gain.â€ The actual line reads â€œfuck yourself with organized religion, now that is some seriously sinninâ€™ business, if the Lord sees their pathetic crimes, Heâ€™ll be fuckinâ€™ them â€™til the end of timeâ€. Fear not, however, if that doesnâ€™t offend you there are a hundred other things in there that will. :)â€

Steve does still have this guitar, but itâ€™s in storage in the vault. Though we get asked about five times a week, Steve doesnâ€™t sell any of his guitars (with the exception of the occasional auction on ebay â€“ the proceeds of which are donated to a charity of Steveâ€™s choice.)

Some tracks were recorded but only one of the songs Steve wrote with Ozzy, â€œMy Little Manâ€, appeared on the record and all of the guitars were redone by Zakk Wylde. Tapes of Steve & Ozzy donâ€™t exist outside the studio, and there are no plans to release any of it.

Hi Steve, I read in your answer to a Malaysian fan that you would like to return there on your upcoming tour. Answers #05:

Why wonâ€™t you release a live video? You got us sobbing and blowing our noses here! Iâ€™ve read in GKS and in a letter to Mike Keneally that you are reluctant to release live material because you think that you make â€œtoo many mistakesâ€ when you play live. (no name given)

â€œBoth of my parents are of Italian descent but were born in America.Vai is actually an Italian word. Itâ€™s the verb â€œto goâ€. Sometimes in South America or Italy people say to each other â€œVai Vai Vaiâ€ & I end up syaing â€œWhat what whatâ€?

Hey Steve, I am Joni Visuri from Finland and I heard that you have a Jackson Soloist. I have a Soloist too and it is THE BEST GUITAR ever. Now I donâ€™t understand why you are playing with Jems â€” I am not saying that it sucks but really, an all-access neck is not really a match for neck-thru or lo-pro Edge for original Floyd Rose.

â€œWell, I donâ€™t know, Joni. I had three Soloists and the neck broke on every one. They just donâ€™t feel half as nice to me as my Jem does. Understand that I played the Soloist when Ibanez was but a gleam in my eye. I bulit the Jem around my playing style so it fits very well. P.S P.S if you answer me i will buy all your records.

Dear Steve, I just purchased â€œFlex-Able Leftovers,â€ and I love it. In terms of the â€œnewâ€ old material, Iâ€™m curious what was done when. Clearly, the vocals for â€œ#$%^ Yourselfâ€ were recorded recently. Are any of the tracks in that song from the original recording? Whatâ€™s the breakdown of new vs. old in the other unreleased tracks?

â€œThe extra songs on Leftovers were done at various times. â€œFuck Yourselfâ€ was written in 1980 but the recording was so poor that I re-recorded it and changed a few of the lines to make more sense with present-day Earth. â€œMassacreâ€ was recorded recently too. It was an experiment with a piece of gear that I was trying out. â€œNatural Born Boyâ€ was written some time ago and the track was recorded about 5 years ago but the guitar was done about a year ago. â€œSan Sebastianâ€was written while I was in San Sebastian, Spain and recorded about 13 years ago â€œThe X-Equilibrium Danceâ€ was written and recorded at about the same time as the Leftovers stuff around 1982.â€

My buddy and I noticed that on all of Steveâ€™s discs the seventh track is always among that discâ€™s best performed, intricate, and amazing songs. These tracks are â€œTender Surrenderâ€, â€œTouching Toungesâ€, â€œHand On Heartâ€, â€œCall It Sleepâ€ and â€œFor The Love of Godâ€. On â€œMerry Axemasâ€, Steveâ€™s track is # 7, is this a coincidence or does Steve have some reason for associating the #7 with such beautiful music?

Uh oh, I think theyâ€™re on to usâ€¦

Iâ€™m interested in the â€œAlien Love Secretsâ€ video but could you explain the differences between the two formats? Respectfully,

â€“ Troy Johnson

Basically, there are two main video formats in the world of home video, NTSC and PAL. People living in North America and Japan use NTSC, while people in Europe, South America, Australia and some other countries use PAL. Unless your player can play both formats (many newer PAL VCRs will play NTSC, but not the other way around), youâ€™ll want to make sure you order the right format. Just to be safe, call a local video store and ask them what format is standard in your region. Visit Merchandise to get a copy.

We actually get this question a lot, especially since the ALS DVD was released. Truth is, Steve doesnâ€™t remember what he named it â€” itâ€™s a single take improvised over the credits.

Itâ€™s actually a Various Artists release called â€œAngelicaâ€, produced by Clif Magness, and Steve plays on one track (Eric Johnson and Dweezil also appear on this disc, among many other incredible musicians). It is available from amazon.com.

Answers #04:

Was there ever a Vai Album released under the title â€œLight Without Heatâ€? Thanks,

Donna Webbon

â€œLight Without Heatâ€ was the original name for the VAI band (1993) and the â€œSex & Religionâ€ record. Both were originally going to be called â€œLight Without Heatâ€, but Steve has a couple of companies by that name already (Light Without Heat Merchandising and an equipment rental company) so it would have been a headache for accounting, file keeping, etc etc. The VAI name added the recognition factor to the bandâ€™s name so that made sense, and as the record progressed, a theme started to emerge and the â€œSex & Religionâ€ title became the right one for the project. Collectors take note: advertisements for â€œLight Without Heatâ€, the band and the record, did actually run in a few music magazines in early 1993 before things were changed.

Since Iâ€™ve seen the section of this site with all of Steveâ€™s guitars, I figured Iâ€™d ask my question here. What is the best position in which to keep your guitar when itâ€™s not being used? I have six guitars and regularly play two of them. It seems that the others are always out of tune. I keep them in their cases. Music stores hang them from the headstock. Is that the best way to keep the neck from bending? Thanks,

Marc

p.s. Who was the opening guitarist at the G3 show in NYC, Mike Kinâ€¦..?

Hanging the guitar by the headstock will not hurt the guitar and is a good way to store it, but not necessarily better than any other way. Provided that there is no undue pressure on any part of the guitar and the humidity/temperature is okay, you should be fine. Steve keeps some guitars hanging, and some in cases stored either horizontally, vertically, sideways, inside outâ€¦. The humidity is probably the factor you want to worry about most, because that can play havoc with your neck especially, and that means tuning problems, intonation problems, and possibly even warping and serious damage. If the room is normal room temperature and not too humid, you should be okay. Avoid leaving guitars near windows where theyâ€™re exposed to direct sunlight, because that can warm up the guitar, and it will cool down at night â€” you want to keep the temperatures pretty stable. Heat or cold is usually okay but going back and forth between the two is bad. This might be part of the problem youâ€™re having with keeping your other 4 guitars in tune. You should get it checked by someone who knows these things, in case you have some warpage. Maybe you just need it set up again or a simple adjustment. Take them to a professional and neglect them no longer! (The guitarist you speak of is none other Mike Keneally, whose band Beer For Dolphins opened the US shows in Nov-Dec 1996, and who also played in Steveâ€™s band each night. For info on our boy wonder, check out his magnificently magnificent website at http://www.keneally.com)

Iâ€™d love to know if youâ€™ve written any classical music, and Iâ€™d also be very grateful if youâ€™d â€œverify my suspicions.â€

Sincerely,

â€“ Justin

Steve responds;

â€œThatâ€™s funny, thereâ€™s a tribe of wild Vais in my living room right now. Their names are Julian and Fireâ€

. Regarding the orchestral music, Steve has written orchestral scores of several pieces both familiar and unheard, including â€œFor The Love Of Godâ€, â€œCall It Sleepâ€, â€œLittle Green Menâ€, â€œLotus Feetâ€, â€œMemories Of A Silent Roseâ€ and others. Steve, backed by 2/3 of his Fire Garden touring band and a 65-piece orchestra led by Joel Thome, performed these arrangements for a live audience in Rochester, New York in September of 1996. The show was dubbed Soundcurrent, but was not recorded for release. Steve would very much like to do a tour like this, using different orchestras in each city, but thatâ€™s a HUGE undertaking and it takes a LOT of time, and Steve is simply too busy juggling everything else at this point. Itâ€™s something close to his heart though, so cross your fingers.

Hi there, my name is Shahriman Aziz, an Iâ€™m a Vai fan from Malaysia. I have a few questions Iâ€™d like to askâ€¦ Is Steve Vai going to visit Malaysia again sometime in the future? I read in the official homepage that â€œSex and Religionâ€ is banned in my country. Why? (Anyway, I have the CDâ€¦)

This recording appeared on the original motion picture soundtrack â€œDudesâ€, and an edit is heard in the movie, which stars Jon Cryer and is worth getting. The soundtrack has long been out of print, but Steve has included this track on the recently released â€œThe Elusive Light and Sound, Vol. 1â€ CD.

I have got to be Steveâ€™s biggest fan. Is it remotely possible that an unknown guitarist such as myself would ever have the â€œdream come trueâ€ chance to jam with Steve?

D. Ace McCloud
